content.rendered: Thirty piano players responded to an advertisement in the Village Voice in August 1974, looking for a player who could play “classical to Jerry Lee Lewis.” Queens-born Roy Bittan, who had been working in bands and Broadway musicals in New York, saw the ad and, after two auditions, was given the job.
